body.p: The Journal of Environment & Development acknowledges books received during 2012.
Aryeetey, E., Devarajan, S., Kanbur, R., & Kasekende, L. (2012). The Oxford companion to the economics of Africa. New York, NY: Oxford University Press.
Baccini, P., & Brunner, P. H. (2012). Metabolism of the anthroposphere. Analysis, evaluation, design (2nd ed.). Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Barbier, E. (2011). Capitalizing on nature. Ecosystems as natural assets. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.
Boyd, E., & Folke, C. (2011). Adapting institutions. Governance, complexity and social-ecological resilience. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.
Bridge, G., & Le Billon, P. (2012). Oil. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Clapp, J. (2012). Food. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Corbridge, S., Harriss, J., & Jeffrey, C. (2012). India today. Economy, politics & society. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
De Young, R., & Princen, T. (Eds.). (2012). The localization reader. Adapting to the coming downshift. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Eland, I. (2011). No war for oil. Oakland, CA: Independent Institute.
Evans, T. L. (2012). Occupy education. Living and learning sustainability. New York, NY: Peter Lang.
Feldman, D. L. (2012). Water. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Gardner, D. B., & Simmons, R. T. (2012). Aquanomics. Water markets and the environment. Oakland, CA: Independent Institute.
Hallowes, D. (2011). Toxic futures. South Africa in the crises of energy, environment and capital. Scottsville, South Africa: University of KwaZulu Press.
Hecht, G. (2012). Being nuclear. Africans and the global uranium trade. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Hopper, P. (2012). Understanding development. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Martin, J., Samels, J. E., & Associates. (2012). The sustainble university. Green goals and new challenges for higher education leaders. Baltimore, MD: Johns Hopkins University Press.
Newell, P. (2012). Globalization and the environment. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Nolan, P. (2012). Is China buying the world? Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Noman, A., Botchwey, K., Stein, H., & Stiglitz, J. (2012). Good growth and governance in Africa. New York, NY: Oxford University Press.
Ridolfi, L., D’Odorico, P., & Laio, F. (2011). Noise-induced phenomena in the environmental sciences. New York, NY: Cambridge University Press.
Scholz, R. W. (2011). Environmental literacy in science and society. From knowledge to decisions. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Severion, J.-M., & Ray, O. (2011). Africa’s moment. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Shapiro, J. (2012). China’s environmental challenges. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Sinn, H.-W. (2012). The green paradox. A supply-side approach to global warming. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Traer, R. (2013). Doing environmental ethics. Boulder, CO: Westview Press.
Weart, S. R. (2012). The rise of nuclear fear. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.
Welzer, H. (2012). Climate wars. Why people will be killed in the 21st century. Malden, MA: Polity Press.
Young, O. (2013). On environmental governance. Sustainability, efficiency, and equity. Boulder, CO: Paradigm.
